pork.notes: Chicken thigh mimics pork fat better than breast
pork.eli5: Pork is from pigs, which are not allowed in Islam.

bacon.notes: Add a dash of oil if turkey is lean
bacon.eli5: Bacon is made from pork, which is forbidden in Islam.

ham.eli5: Ham is made from pork, which is forbidden in Islam.

lard.eli5: Lard is fat from pigs, which is forbidden in Islam.

pate.eli5: Pâté is often made from pork liver, which is forbidden.

pepperoni.notes: Typically pork-based. Halal beef preserves spice and chew
pepperoni.eli5: Pepperoni is usually made from pork, which is forbidden.

salami.notes: Pork is default meat. Must be halal-certified
salami.eli5: Salami is usually made from pork, which is forbidden.

hot_dogs.notes: Often pork or mixed meat. Must be halal-certified
hot_dogs.eli5: Hot dogs often contain pork, which is forbidden.

sausage.notes: Choose seasoned chicken sausage to match flavor profile
sausage.eli5: Many sausages contain pork, which is forbidden.

gelatin.notes: Agar is stronger than gelatin. Check the source before consuming. Must be halal-certified if animal-derived
gelatin.eli5: Gelatin is made from animal parts, so whether it's halal depends on the animal.

marshmallows.notes: Marshmallows typically contain gelatin, which may come from pork sources. Must be halal-certified gelatin
marshmallows.eli5: Marshmallows often contain gelatin, which may come from pork.

gummy_candy.notes: Pork gelatin common. Must be halal-certified gelatin
gummy_candy.eli5: Gummy candy often contains gelatin, which may come from pork.

jello.notes: Typically contains pork gelatin. Use agar-agar for halal version
jello.eli5: Jello contains gelatin, which may come from pork.

lucky_charms.notes: Lucky Charms contain marshmallows that typically use pork-derived gelatin
lucky_charms.eli5: Lucky Charms contain marshmallows that usually use pork gelatin.

marshmallow_fluff.eli5: Marshmallow fluff usually contains gelatin, which may come from pork.

panna_cotta.notes: Traditionally uses gelatin. Use agar-agar for halal version
panna_cotta.eli5: Panna cotta contains gelatin, which may come from pork.

cheesecake.notes: May contain gelatin in some recipes. Check ingredients or make halal version
cheesecake.eli5: Some cheesecakes contain gelatin, so check the ingredients.

yogurt_with_gelatin.notes: Check ingredients. Some yogurts use gelatin as thickener
yogurt_with_gelatin.eli5: Some yogurt contains gelatin to make it thicker, so check the ingredients.

ice_cream_gelatin.eli5: Some ice cream contains gelatin, so check the ingredients.

alcohol.notes: Alcohol in any form is prohibited in Islam

wine.eli5: Wine contains alcohol, which is not allowed in Islam.

beer.eli5: Beer contains alcohol, which is forbidden in Islam.

rum.notes: Mimics depth without alcohol. Even small amounts are impermissible
rum.eli5: Rum contains alcohol, which is forbidden in Islam.

brandy.eli5: Brandy contains alcohol, which is forbidden in Islam.

whiskey.eli5: Whiskey contains alcohol, which is forbidden in Islam.

vodka.eli5: Vodka contains alcohol, which is forbidden in Islam.

mirin.eli5: Mirin contains alcohol, which is forbidden in Islam.

sake.eli5: Sake contains alcohol, which is forbidden in Islam.

vanilla_extract.notes: Ensure alcohol-free labeling. Some scholars allow trace amounts, others don't
vanilla_extract.eli5: Vanilla extract often has a little bit of alcohol in it, so check if it's alcohol-free.

almond_extract.notes: Often contains alcohol as carrier. Check for alcohol-free version
almond_extract.eli5: Almond extract might have alcohol, so check for alcohol-free versions.

lemon_extract.notes: May contain alcohol. Use lemon zest or juice instead
lemon_extract.eli5: Lemon extract might have alcohol, so use lemon zest or juice instead.

beef.eli5: Beef is halal if the animal was prepared in the Islamic way.

chicken.eli5: Chicken is halal if the animal was prepared in the Islamic way.

lamb.eli5: Lamb is halal if the animal was prepared in the Islamic way.

turkey.eli5: Turkey is halal if the animal was prepared in the Islamic way.

ground_meat.notes: Must be halal-certified. Often contains mixed or non-halal meat
ground_meat.eli5: Ground meat must be from halal-certified animals.

meatballs.notes: Frozen products often non-halal. Contains pork or non-halal beef
meatballs.eli5: Store-bought meatballs often contain pork or non-halal meat.

rennet_cheese.notes: Most rennet comes from non-halal calves. Microbial rennet is halal-safe
rennet_cheese.eli5: Some cheese is made with enzymes from animals that weren't slaughtered halal.

animal_rennet.notes: Common in cheese production. Check for microbial/vegetarian sources
animal_rennet.eli5: Animal rennet comes from the stomach of calves that may not be halal.

parmesan_cheese.notes: Traditionally uses animal rennet. Look for vegetarian or halal-certified versions
parmesan_cheese.eli5: Parmesan cheese often uses animal rennet, which may not be halal.

blue_cheese.notes: Often uses animal rennet. Check for halal-certified versions
blue_cheese.eli5: Blue cheese often uses animal rennet, which may not be halal.

feta_cheese.notes: May use animal rennet. Check ingredients or use halal-certified
feta_cheese.eli5: Feta cheese might use animal rennet, so check the ingredients.

mono_diglycerides.notes: Source-dependent ingredient. May be animal-derived unless specified plant-based
mono_diglycerides.eli5: This ingredient can come from animal or plant sources, so check the label.

l_cysteine.notes: Often derived from human hair or feathers. Must be plant-based or synthetic
l_cysteine.eli5: This ingredient often comes from human hair, which is not halal.

carmine.notes: Derived from insects (cochineal). Some schools allow, others don't
carmine.eli5: This red color comes from insects, which some Muslims avoid.

shellac.notes: Derived from insects. Used as shiny coating on candies
shellac.eli5: This shiny coating comes from insects, which some Muslims avoid.

pepsin.notes: Derived from pig stomach lining. Must use plant-based alternatives
pepsin.eli5: Pepsin comes from pig stomachs, which is forbidden.

animal_shortening.notes: May contain pork fat. Check label for animal fats
animal_shortening.eli5: This shortening might contain pork fat, so check the label.

glycerin.notes: Animal origin possible. Must be vegetable glycerin
glycerin.eli5: Glycerin can come from animals or plants, so check for vegetable glycerin.

lecithin_animal.notes: Animal lecithin uncommon but possible. Soy or sunflower preferred
lecithin_animal.eli5: Lecithin can come from animals, so look for soy or sunflower lecithin.

lipase.notes: Often pork-derived unless specified. Used in cheese flavoring
lipase.eli5: Lipase often comes from pork, which is forbidden.

natural_flavors_meat.notes: Can contain meat or alcohol carriers. Check for halal-certified or plant-based
natural_flavors_meat.eli5: Natural flavors might contain meat or alcohol, so check for halal versions.

whey_protein.notes: May be from non-halal dairy. Check for halal-certified
whey_protein.eli5: Whey protein might come from non-halal dairy, so check for halal-certified.

casein.notes: Milk protein. Check for halal-certified dairy source
casein.eli5: Casein is a milk protein, so make sure it's from halal dairy.

worcestershire_sauce.notes: Often fermented with alcohol. Check for halal-certified version
worcestershire_sauce.eli5: This sauce might contain alcohol, so check for halal versions.

teriyaki_sauce.notes: Often contains mirin or sake (alcohol). Make homemade halal version
teriyaki_sauce.eli5: Teriyaki sauce often contains alcohol from mirin or sake.

oyster_sauce.notes: Some brands contain alcohol. Hanafi school: haram due to shellfish. Others: check for alcohol
oyster_sauce.eli5: This sauce contains oysters and might have alcohol, so check for halal versions.

soy_sauce.notes: Naturally produces alcohol during fermentation. Most scholars allow if trace amounts
soy_sauce.eli5: Soy sauce naturally has tiny amounts of alcohol from fermentation, but most scholars allow it.

hoisin_sauce.eli5: Hoisin sauce might contain alcohol, so check the ingredients.

bbq_sauce.notes: Some brands add whiskey or wine
bbq_sauce.eli5: BBQ sauce might contain alcohol, so check the ingredients.

demi_glace.eli5: Demi-glace is usually made with wine, which contains alcohol.

ramen_seasoning.notes: Often contains pork extract or pork-based flavoring
ramen_seasoning.eli5: Ramen seasoning often contains pork flavoring, which is forbidden.

frozen_lasagna.notes: Contains pork or non-halal beef. Check ingredients carefully
frozen_lasagna.eli5: Frozen lasagna often contains pork or meat that isn't halal.

refried_beans.notes: Lard frequently used. Must check label for vegetable oil version
refried_beans.eli5: Refried beans are often cooked with pork fat, so check the label.

canned_soup.notes: Hidden animal fats common. Check ingredients
canned_soup.eli5: Canned soup might contain pork fat or non-halal meat, so check the ingredients.

gravy_mix.notes: Often contains meat extract or pork flavoring
gravy_mix.eli5: Gravy mix often contains pork or non-halal meat extracts.

stuffing_mix.eli5: Stuffing mix might contain pork fat, so check the ingredients.

potato_chips_lard.notes: Some brands fry in pork fat
potato_chips_lard.eli5: Some potato chips are fried in pork fat, so check the label.

donuts.eli5: Donuts might be fried in pork fat, so check where they're from.

pastries_with_lard.eli5: Pastries often contain pork fat (lard), which is forbidden.

custard.eli5: Custard might contain vanilla extract with alcohol, so check the ingredients.

cake_glaze.notes: Some glazes use alcohol. Use fruit or sugar glazes instead
cake_glaze.eli5: Some cake glazes use alcohol, so check the ingredients.

liqueur_chocolate.notes: Contains intoxicants. Avoid all chocolate with alcohol fillings
liqueur_chocolate.eli5: This chocolate contains alcohol, which is forbidden.

tiramisu.notes: Contains coffee liqueur or alcohol. Make halal version without alcohol
tiramisu.eli5: Tiramisu contains alcohol, which is forbidden.

rum_cake.eli5: Rum cake contains alcohol, which is forbidden.

chocolate_liqueurs.notes: Contains alcohol fillings. Avoid all varieties
chocolate_liqueurs.eli5: These chocolates contain alcohol, which is forbidden.

chicken_broth.eli5: Chicken broth must be from halal-certified chickens.

beef_broth.notes: Common in soups and rice. Must be halal-certified
beef_broth.eli5: Beef broth must be from halal-certified beef.

meat_extract.notes: Yeast provides similar depth. Often contains non-halal meat
meat_extract.eli5: Meat extract often contains pork or non-halal meat.

cooking_spray.eli5: Cooking spray might contain animal-based ingredients, so check the label.

mustard_wine.eli5: Some mustard uses wine vinegar, so check the ingredients.

wine_vinegar.notes: No alcohol involvement in final product. Some scholars allow
wine_vinegar.eli5: Wine vinegar is usually okay because the alcohol is gone, but some Muslims avoid it.

balsamic_vinegar.notes: Traditional balsamic is grape-based only, no alcohol. Check ingredients
balsamic_vinegar.eli5: Real balsamic vinegar doesn't have alcohol, but check the ingredients to be sure.

pancetta.notes: Italian cured pork belly. Use halal beef or turkey version
pancetta.eli5: Pancetta is made from pork, which is forbidden.

prosciutto.notes: Italian dry-cured ham. Must use halal-certified alternatives
prosciutto.eli5: Prosciutto is made from pork, which is forbidden.

pork_belly.notes: High fat content. Chicken thigh works well
pork_belly.eli5: Pork belly is from pigs, which are forbidden.

chorizo.notes: Spicy sausage typically pork-based. Use halal beef or chicken version
chorizo.eli5: Chorizo is usually made from pork, which is forbidden.

jelly_candies.notes: Pork gelatin common. Must be halal-certified
jelly_candies.eli5: Jelly candies often contain gelatin, which may come from pork.

fruit_snacks.eli5: Fruit snacks might contain gelatin, so check the ingredients.

mousse.notes: Some recipes use gelatin. Check ingredients or make without gelatin
mousse.eli5: Some mousse desserts contain gelatin, so check the ingredients.

pate_de_fruit.notes: Traditionally uses pectin or gelatin. Use agar-agar for halal version
pate_de_fruit.eli5: Fruit paste might contain gelatin, so check the ingredients.

grand_marnier.notes: Orange-flavored liqueur. Use orange extract instead
grand_marnier.eli5: Grand Marnier contains alcohol, which is forbidden.

kirsch.notes: Cherry-flavored alcohol. Use cherry extract or juice
kirsch.eli5: Kirsch contains alcohol, which is forbidden.

amaretto.notes: Almond-flavored liqueur. Use almond extract instead
amaretto.eli5: Amaretto contains alcohol, which is forbidden.

kahlua.notes: Coffee-flavored liqueur. Use strong espresso instead
kahlua.eli5: Kahlua contains alcohol, which is forbidden.

brie_cheese.notes: May use animal rennet. Check for vegetarian or halal-certified
brie_cheese.eli5: Brie cheese might use animal rennet, so check the ingredients.

camembert.notes: Soft cheese may use animal rennet. Check label
camembert.eli5: Camembert might use animal rennet, so check the ingredients.

gouda.notes: Often uses animal rennet. Look for vegetarian or halal versions
gouda.eli5: Gouda might use animal rennet, so check the ingredients.

cheddar.notes: May use animal rennet. Check for vegetarian or halal versions
cheddar.eli5: Cheddar cheese might use animal rennet, so check the ingredients.

swiss_cheese.notes: Often uses animal rennet. Check for halal-certified versions
swiss_cheese.eli5: Swiss cheese might use animal rennet, so check the ingredients.

stearic_acid.notes: Can be animal or plant-derived. Must be plant-based
stearic_acid.eli5: Stearic acid can come from animals, so check for plant-based versions.

palmitic_acid.notes: Fatty acid that can be animal or plant-derived
palmitic_acid.eli5: This ingredient can come from animals, so check the source.

oleic_acid.notes: Usually plant-derived but can be animal-sourced. Check label
oleic_acid.eli5: Oleic acid usually comes from plants, but check the label to be sure.

beeswax.notes: Beeswax is generally considered halal. Used as food coating
beeswax.eli5: Beeswax comes from bees and is generally considered halal.

instant_noodles.notes: Seasoning packets often contain pork extract. Check for halal-certified brands
instant_noodles.eli5: Instant noodles often contain pork flavoring in the seasoning packet.

frozen_pizza.notes: Often contains pepperoni or pork. Check ingredients carefully
frozen_pizza.eli5: Frozen pizza often contains pork toppings like pepperoni.

hot_pockets.notes: Often contains pepperoni or pork sausage. Check ingredients
hot_pockets.eli5: Hot pockets often contain pork products like pepperoni or sausage.

frozen_burritos.notes: Often contains pork or lard. Check for halal-certified versions
frozen_burritos.eli5: Frozen burritos often contain pork or pork fat.

beef_jerky.notes: Must be halal-certified. Often contains non-halal meat
beef_jerky.eli5: Beef jerky must be from halal-certified beef.

creme_brulee.eli5: Crème brûlée might contain vanilla extract with alcohol, so check the ingredients.

ice_cream_alcohol.notes: Some premium ice creams contain alcohol. Avoid all varieties with alcohol
ice_cream_alcohol.eli5: Some ice cream contains alcohol, which is forbidden.

chocolate_truffles.notes: May contain liqueur fillings. Check ingredients or make halal version
chocolate_truffles.eli5: Some chocolate truffles contain alcohol, so check the ingredients.

artificial_flavoring.notes: May contain alcohol carriers or meat-based flavors. Check for halal-certified
artificial_flavoring.eli5: Artificial flavoring might contain alcohol or meat, so check for halal versions.

msg.notes: Generally halal if derived from plant sources or fermentation. Check source
msg.eli5: MSG is usually halal if it comes from plants or fermentation.
